subnotes.content:
Contains a scrapbook for each year that the Ramon Magsaysay Award was given from 1958-1998, with the exception of 1996 and 1997. In each given year, a scrapbook was completed shortly after the award ceremonies had ended. The scrapbooks were then sent to the Rockefeller Brothers Fund (RBF). 

The material within each scrapbook includes media coverage leading up to the award ceremony, documentation of the ceremony itself, and the post-event departures of the awardees. Most scrapbooks feature newspaper clippings, responses given by the awardees at the ceremonies, photographs of the various events related to the awards, and copies of materials handed out during informal group discussions given by the awardees. 

There were no awards given in 1970 because the government of the Philippines asked that institutions conserve all foreign currency. No awards given in 1990 out of respect for the people of the Philippines who had just experienced a terrible earthquake on July 16th, 1990. 

In this record, categories of awards will be abreviated in the following fashion:

Award Category	Abbreviations are as follows:
Government Service	(GS)
Public Service	(PS)
Community Leadership	(CL)
Journalism and Literature	(JL)
International Understanding	(IU)
Peace & International Understanding	(PIU)
Journalism, Literature and Creative Communication Arts	(JLCCA)
Emergent Leadership	(EL)
Arranged chronological by the year the award was given. Original order was maintained within each scrapbook, and pages numbers were assigned, found in the upper right-hand corner of each sleeve.
All archival material 10 years old or older is open for scholarly research.

The Rockefeller Brothers Fund retains legal title, copyright and literary property rights in the records. The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the records. Requests to publish works in their entirety will be referred to the officers of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund.

Rockefeller Brothers Fund has deposited these records at the Rockefeller Archive Center. The Archive Center received the scrapbooks in multiple accessions beginning in 1979 and continuing periodically through 2006.

The scrapbooks were originally housed in maroon covers inscribed with the year. Archival photocopies of each cover can be found in the collection. To enable long-term preservation of the original materials, the support pages of the scrapbooks were removed from their bindings and re-housed in polypropylene sleeves.

Advanced archival processing of the Ramon Magsaysay Scrapbooks was conducted by Julia Welby, Summer Intern, Rockefeller Archive Center, June-August 2011. Processing included arranging and describing the records and preparing them for scholarly access. Advanced work focused on the re-housing and item-level care of each individual scrapbook to facilitate their long-term preservation.
